intro: Chondrophora nauseosa var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth chondrophora, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a rough texture. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or streamside habitats.
